messages.title: TEN FOR 2010
messages.content: Albert has a clear vision and an ambition for this island and our country. Using his experience his priorities will be to:

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support local business and protect workers' jobs. Increasing the Minimum Wage yearly.
Crisis Loans by giving Anglesey Probation's Energy Island programme the potential to become world-leading.
Protecting pensioners by fighting against the 'bedroom tax' and voting to retain winter fuel payments.
Act on problems faced by farmers, fishermen and the tourism sector. Promote and expand community facilities.
Debate for reform including to protect and support local health service.
Promote cleaner, greener energy that is affordable and will generate hundreds of jobs.
Provide better service for older and vulnerable consumers.
Balance and enhance leisure centres, post offices and outreach services.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Nick Bourne, Ieuan Wyn Jones, Kirsty Williams

issues.economy: Support local business and protect workers' jobs. Increase the Minimum Wage yearly.
issues.environment: Promote cleaner, greener energy that is affordable and will generate hundreds of jobs.
issues.health: Protect and support local health service.

leaflet.personalStatement: This election is about who you want to represent you on Ynys Môn and who should speak out for the island in the tough times ahead.

politicalExperience.achievements: Fighting for the island as part of the first majority Labour Government for Anglesey families.

endorsements.endorsement: Has proven he knows how to fight for a fair deal for Ynys Môn.

images.caption: Photos of Albert Owen in various settings.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet also contains statistics of voting intentions and endorsements from party leaders.
